html: Amidst the gloomy prospect that faces the reprobates of Jehovah’s people, Isaiah reminds Jehovah’s “sheep” and “proselytes”—his covenant people—that when his Day of Judgment is over they will inherit the wealthy estates of the wicked who perish (cf. v 9): “Jehovah will have compassion on Jacob and once again choose Israel; he will settle them in their own land, and proselytes will adhere to them and join the house of Jacob” ( Isaiah 14:1; cf. 58:12; 61:4-5). The imagery of sheep feeding in their pasture additionally portrays an agrarian millennial economy ( Isaiah 30:23-24; 32:15-20; 65:10).
